meanings.sent1: Wearing a prophylactic mask can help keep you healthy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a prophylactic vaccine to avoid getting sick.
meanings.sent3: Carrying hand sanitizer is like having a tiny prophylactic shield against germs.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a prophylactic barrier against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The prophylactic measures in place ensured the safety of everyone in the building.

meanings.definition: A measure taken to prevent disease
meanings.sent1: Taking a daily vitamin can be a good prophylactic against illnesses.
meanings.sent2: The government implemented strict prophylactic measures during the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: His habit of washing hands frequently became his favorite prophylactic routine.
meanings.sent4: The new policy served as a prophylactic shield for the community.
meanings.sent5: The prophylactic action of getting regular check-ups saved his life.

meanings.definition: A condom used to prevent pregnancy or sexually transmitted infections
meanings.sent1: It's important to always use a prophylactic during intimate moments.
meanings.sent2: He made sure to have a prophylactic in his wallet at all times.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the awkwardness of buying prophylactics at the store.
meanings.sent4: The prophylactic was a small but crucial item in their nightstand.
meanings.sent5: She emphasized the importance of using a prophylactic to her friends.
